title: If any person have two goats, one sold at 20% profit and the other was sold at 20% loss, what will be the total profit loss percentage overall? - Quora

response.answer_text: Say both goats are bought for Rs.100 each. Goat 1 is sold for 20% profit, hence selling price of goat 1 is 120/100* 100 = 120. Goat 2 is sold for 20% loss, hence selling price of goat 2 is 80/100 * 100 = 80. Total costs = 200 Total revenue = 200. So net net there is no effect. If however, there is a different price for each goat, then there is a difference. Simply plug in the numbers above and do the math. You may also need to account for age of goat, color, weight etc.

There is no definite answer for this question. Suppose, the cost price of the first goat is 1000 and the cost price of the second goat is 500. The overall gain is 200–100 = 100. If you interchange the cost prices, then the overall loss is 100–200 = -100. If the cost price is same for both the goats, then there is no gain or loss.
